newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end off highs, upside limited.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end off highs, upside limited.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures shed a good part of their gains by Tuesday's close after failing to break above an early high. The gains were inspired by a better-than-expected land auction in central Tokyo the previous day.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 March contract finished 185 points firmer at 18,335 after hitting an early high of 18,670.
"It looks like the market is adjusting positions ahead of tonight's meeting," said a dealer at a Japanese house, referring to the U.S. Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting.
Most analysts and market participants expect the Fed to hold interest rates steady at the two-day meeting, which ends on Wednesday.
"If nothing happens tonight, I'd see a pullback to 18,500 tomorrow," said the trader, adding that the March Nikkei would need to breach Tuesday's peak of 18,670 to head higher.
A chartist with a local institution said the contract could come off to cover a gap near 18,000 before heading back up to test the 18,670 level.
"I'll only be convinced of the upside if it breaks and closes above 19,300," he added.
Taiwan stock index futures were not traded as the Taipei stock market was closed for the beginning of a seven-day Lunar New Year break. Trading will resume on February 11.
On Monday, the March MSCI Taiwan index contract ended at 315.9 against its opening 316.5 on a turnover of 62 lots.
